scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 246193072 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 246193072 is a star with 0.9 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.82 times its radius. It is located 760.72 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.8 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

EPIC 246193072 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 246193072 system


EPIC 246193072 b

EPIC 246193072 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2020-10, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 246193072 b is 82.680 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 246193072 b is 8.676 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, EPIC 246193072 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system EPIC 246193072, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: EPIC 246193072 - System With 1 Exoplanet
